text:
392 Classiﬁcation with Support Vector Machines
is an N by N matrix where the elements of the diagonal are from y, and
X∈RN×D is the matrix obtained by concatenating all the examples.
We can similarly perform a collection of terms for the dual version of the
SVM (12.41). To express the dual SVM in standard form, we ﬁrst have to
express the kernel matrix Ksuch that each entry isKij = k(xi,xj). If we
have an explicit feature representation xi then we deﬁne Kij = ⟨xi,xj⟩.
